step_1.description: The paper explicitly states that PINK1 mutations cause PARK6 via loss of function, directly linking the variant to mitochondrial dysfunction.

step_2.description: Mitochondrial function assays (ΔΨm, morphology, ROS) are directly relevant to the disease mechanism of PARK6.

3a.description: Controls (wild-type PINK1 and PINK1 knockout) are present, but replicates are not explicitly mentioned in the abstract.

3b.description: Mitochondrial function assays are standard in the field and validated for studying PARK6 pathogenesis.

4a.description: No explicit OddsPath calculation or statistical analysis is reported in the abstract.

4b.description: Only 1 pathogenic control variant (wild-type PINK1) is used, with no additional benign/pathogenic controls.
